poem:
"Unheard Voices in the Ivory Tower"

In the Sonoma morning,
a President felled by agreement -
so ripe with discord. 
A demand! By the young
for justice and Palestine.
Israel waits, a heavy import on
California's vine-laden conscience. 

But who is the vine and
who the ripe grape -
Insubordination or awakening?
Dissonance blooms under the academic sun,
a fruitful rebellion.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "University president in California on leave after agreeing to campus protesters’ demands A public university in California has placed its president on leave for “insubordination” after he agreed to student demands for an academic boycott of Israel. Mike Lee was suspended from Sonoma State University following an announcement on Tuesday that the liberal arts college north of San Francisco had agreed with Students for Justice in Palestine (SJP) to become the first US university to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
